--- title: Advertorial - Examples - Debugging module: rui-advertorial categories: Components excludeFromToc: true ---

Debugging Tools

RUI Advertorial comes with a couple of useful debugging tools that you can use to control which ads are rendered on the page. This is done via some _query string_ parameters:
  • `rui_ads_disabled=true`
  • `rui_ads_only_pos=[,]`
  • `rui_ads_env=`
  • `rui_ads_fcid=`

You can get debug info on which ads are being disabled by adding `rui-debug=true` to the query string and then in the console typing: **`RUI.Debug.printLog()`**.

`rui_ads_disabled`

This is a kill switch to disable all Ad units on a page. Try it now - kill them all!.

`rui_ads_only_pos`

This is a whitelist of Ad units we want to render. Simply supply a comma separated list of `pos` values that you want enabled. This is handy for performance testing a specific ad unit in isolation.
  • Only enable the first ad
  • Only enable the second ad
  • Why not both?

`rui_ads_env`

This param allows us to use **feature toggles** for ad campaigns. It basically adds a new targetting param to the ad call which can then be used to traffic ads only when the correct "env" value is present. If an "env" value is already in the ad call the value supplied in the query string will override it. For example if we want to test a new Floor Ad campaign on the Homepage we could add `rui_ads_env=floor-ad-experiment-5`. Using this toggle we can have multiple feature toggles at once. Toggle values are restricted to **word characters (alphanumeric, `_`, `-`)** to prevent XSS and general silliness.
Try it now - the ads below should change.

`rui_ads_fcid`

Force SAS to deliver the creative with the **FCID** supplied as a value in all ad spots. Useful if you have a campaign with multiple creatives and you want to view just one of them.
Try it - ads below should become Sammy

Some ads units to demo the functionality
